content:
I wonder if anyone of you is familiar with the concepts behind localize.backdropcms.org How to contribute translations?

Can't seem to find much documentation about our translation server.
Another question: are there any plans yet for the functionality that l10n_update provides for D7? It has 162k+ installs. Should this go to core or contrib?

Yeah, no documentation unfortunately @indigoxela ...I believe that the process is to create a user account there, and someone with access can add you to the language group you are interested to contribute to ... @Olaf Grabienski and myself are some of the people with proper permissions to do that, so shout here once you've created an account.
Ah, cool. ... shouldn't we provide some documentation then? Your post here is more than I could find elsewhere. :wink:

...I saw that @jenlampton and @BWPanda (Peter) have user accounts there (most likely from when we were trying to implement a SSO between all our sites), so I have added the "developer" and "groups manager" roles to their accounts. More hands on deck now :wink:
...I'll edit the existing "Welcome" article that's at the top of the home page, to include some basic instructions for people that want to contribute.
Done @indigoxela (it's a start - please feel free to recommend improvements to the text).
Hey @klonos and @indigoxela I can provide some more documentation after my vacation (next week).
Thanks @Olaf Grabienski ...you certainly have more experience on how things work, so I'll gladly leave it to you for when you return from your vacation :sweat_smile:

In the meantime maybe someone is adventurous enough to test the client. Port started yesterday - I belief it works now.

backdrop-contrib/l10n_client
Backdrop CMS translation interface module. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/l10n_client development by creating an account on GitHub.
@indigoxela if you are happy to release an alpha or beta, then it'd be easier to test on our demo sites.
How does releasing an alpha work? What does the tag have to look like then? Never did that and I have no clue how the packager script handles that.
@klonos a suggestion re the article on localize.backdropcms.org - fix the link behind the user registration page it currently leads to a totally wrong place. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
Thanks :sweat_smile: ...fixed.
I'm gonna go take a nap ...let me know if you create an account and need access @indigoxela

Documentation for this would be great. Maybe let's add a page on the
localize site?
Yup, that's the plan @jenlampton ... @Olaf Grabienski will update the https://localize.backdropcms.org/welcome page after he gets back.
Checking in to update the localization server documentation...

FYI @klonos and @indigoxela - Rough workflow for the time being: when someone registers an user account on localize.backdropcms.org, I get an email, prepare the language, enable the user account and provide the person with instructions.

There's also an issue regarding "How to contribute translations": https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/507. Some notes for documentation here: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/507#issuecomment-468649064

Documentation: How to contribute translations · Issue #507 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We should have either official documentation, or a blog post on this subject.
Documentation: How to contribute translations · Issue #507 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We should have either official documentation, or a blog post on this subject.

Guessing the workflow... I download the latest .po for my language, import it into a vanilla Backdrop install and start translating stuff (with the client). Then I export my translation .po file and... then... put it where?
Updated the "Welcome message" on localize.backdropcms.org.

I should note that I'm not familiar with the Drupal translation workflow either, as I never contributed.

@Olaf Grabienski Thanks for updating the text.
@indigoxela Pragmatically speaking: Please create an account, then I "get in touch with you to coordinate the contribution process in detail". :wink:
Preview: you will then subscribe e.g. for the German translation group, and with the role of a "Translation Supervisor" you'll be able to import the file.
Btw, I also didn't know the Drupal workflow before... Anyway, the localization server has its limitations but there are workarounds (and if we want we can still improve it).

Sooo... I may register but email verification is off and I couldn't set my password either when registering. Now I get a mail that my account has been unblocked but I actually have to "reset" my password first because I never was able to set it... :stuck_out_tongue_wink: Yes, we can improve that.
Ah, wait, I can't reset my pw either ... neither with username nor with email - unknown... giving up for now.
Oh, thanks for reporting, never heard of it before. Will look into it later, @indigoxela.

@indigoxela I may have simply forgotton to set your account status to "Active", maybe I've just saved the account page without any change before I sent you the welcome message. Hope you got the system mail now and you're able to log in.
@Olaf Grabienski it worked now. I guess you were in a hurry yesterday ... can happen. :wink:
@indigoxela Great! Now don't forget to subscribe for the German translation group.

We should either automate this as much as possible, or get more people on that notification list (I'm putting my hand up, since I don't think we have that many people contributing ATM) ...ideally, we'll get more hands on deck (is it just you right now @Olaf Grabienski ?) ...and even more ideally, we'll get a notification going here on Zulip (same as with the forum post notifications), so that more of us can jump in :wink:

@klonos thanks for putting your hand up :-) Right, at the moment, it's just me. Worked fine so far but more than one person is always a good idea. As a start, would you mind to file a "more hands on deck" issue on https://github.com/backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org/issues? That could then also be the place where I share the current workflow (mail texts to new people and so on).

backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org
Host translation files for Backdrop CMS. Contribute to backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.
Sure ..in the meantime, if you have access to add my email to the people that get notified, then please do so.
...I'll PM you my address.
...or you can find it under https://localize.backdropcms.org/user/3/edit :wink:

...and done: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org/issues/40

More hands on deck for approving/activating new translator accounts · Issue #40 · backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org
Currently, only @olafgrabienski gets notified when new accounts are created in localize.backdropcms.org. He then has to manually activate the accounts, and communicate with people that want to cont...
Another question regarding the concept... How do people usually translate? Via the admin UI? Via a local software like poedit?
The few times I tested that back before Backdrop, I did it via the UI @indigoxela

As a tool the l10n_client seems handy to me, because I can see the strings in (visual) context. First release happened recently.

@Olaf Grabienski I imported a de.po at localize.backdrop.org I hope I didn't mess anything. I visited the commonly most used pages/forms and translated whatever looked urgent (and was translatable).
@indigoxela Thanks for your translations! I've repackaged the language files, so your translations should be part of them now.
Thanks! It's not a huge improvement, though. Only 51 additional strings, but all on pages that are frequently used (node form and stuff...)

I see! It's in any case good to see it moving, motivates me to also do something translation-wise. Currently I'm reviewing the pending German translations suggestions (most of them just technically suggestions, current translations are mostly better).
@indigoxela When I've cleaned up the translation suggestions queue, we can use it to focus on some interesting translation questions.

@klonos Still interested to help to instruct new people on the translation server? I've written up the current workflow: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/localize.backdropcms.org/issues/40#issuecomment-668038958, please have a look. If you're fine with it, I'll add your email.
